citations.narrative:
* Three enclosures, all housing two Dromedary Camels, six Alpacas, one Llama, two Red Kangaroos and three
Wallabies, have Conex contains for shelter. The pressed foam insulation is exposed in these shelters and shows signs of
chewing and or scratching along the edges of the insulation. This insulation is at head level allowing access for the
animals of concern. As a result, the animals could chew or eat the insulation causing injury.
* The Shelter used to house the two Red Kangaroos and Three Wallabies, has an electric heater mount on the wall inside
the shelter. The electrical cords for this heater are hanging down, from the heater to the outlet inside the enclosure. These
cords were not live, but are at head level of the animals of concern. The animals can chew and or get tangled in the cords
causing injury.
For the prevention of injury, all housing for the animals must be constructed of material, the insulation, appropriate for the
animals involved. This also includes the electrical wires hanging down into the enclosure must be constructed as to
prevent injury.
To be corrected by 22-October-2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
* Three enclosures, all housing two Dromedary Camels, six Alpacas, one Llama, two Red Kangaroos and three 
Wallabies, have Conex contains for shelter. The pressed foam insulation is exposed in these shelters and shows signs of 
chewing and or scratching along the edges of the insulation. This insulation is at head level allowing access for the 
animals of concern. As a result, the animals could chew or eat the insulation causing injury.  
 
* The Shelter used to house the two Red Kangaroos and Three Wallabies, has an electric heater mount on the wall inside 
the shelter. The electrical cords for this heater are hanging down, from the heater to the outlet inside the enclosure. These 
cords were not live, but are at head level of the animals of concern. The animals can chew and or get tangled in the cords 
causing injury.  
 
For the prevention of injury, all housing for the animals must be constructed of material, the insulation, appropriate for the 
animals involved. This also includes the electrical wires hanging down into the enclosure must be constructed as to 
prevent injury.  
 
To be corrected by 22-October-2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
 n
